Package com.amiasya.core.manager

Class ProvidersManager

java.lang.Object
com.amiasya.core.manager.ProvidersManager
public class ProvidersManager extends Object
ProvidersManager is the class that manages all the chat providers. In this class you can do some customizations
Version:
1.2
Author:
Matthew Schwart

    • isProvider

      public boolean isProvider(org.bukkit.plugin.Plugin plugin)
      Not related to your own plugin's localization management But you can use this to check if a certain plugin is a registered/hooked chatprovider
      Parameters:
      plugin - the plugin to check if it is the provider
      Returns:
      if it is provider?

    • getProvider

      public ChatProvider getProvider(org.bukkit.plugin.Plugin plugin)
      Not related to your own plugin's localization management but you can use this method to get the ChatProvider of other plugins and make your reference or sth (Though i do not recommend you to use this because mind your own business)
      Parameters:
      plugin - of which the ChatProvider to fetch.
      Returns:
      the ChatProvider to fetch

      public boolean pollUpdateForAllLocales(org.bukkit.plugin.Plugin plugin)
      As its function name implies, it updates your language messages for ALL LANGUAGES
      Parameters:
      plugin - put your plugin's instance here (your class that extends JavaPlugin)
      Returns:
      a boolean that tells if the operation is successful
      See Also:

    • pollUpdate

      public boolean pollUpdate(org.bukkit.plugin.Plugin plugin, Locale l)
      As its function name implies, it updates your language messages for only the locale you specified
      Parameters:
      plugin - put your plugin's instance here (your class that extends JavaPlugin)
      l - the locale(language) you want to update
      Returns:
      a boolean that tells if the operation is successful
      See Also:
      • pollSingleUpdate(org.bukkit.plugin.Plugin,java.util.Locale,java.lang.String)

    • pollSingleUpdate

      public boolean pollSingleUpdate(org.bukkit.plugin.Plugin plugin, Locale l, String langKey)
      It updates ONE SINGLE MESSAGE of ONE LOCALE This should be used for efficiency of updating a few messages Instead of updating all which is a waste of cpu resources
      Parameters:
      plugin - put your plugin's instance here (your class that extends JavaPlugin)
      l - the locale(language) you want to update
      langKey - the key whose message you wants to update
      Returns:
      a boolean that tells if the operation is successful
      See Also:
      • pollUpdateForAllLocales(org.bukkit.plugin.Plugin)

    • notifyLocaleChange

      public boolean notifyLocaleChange(org.bukkit.plugin.Plugin plugin, Locale locale, org.bukkit.entity.Player player)
      This method allows you to attempt to change locale for a given player from a given ChatProvider(from a plugin)
      Parameters:
      plugin - the plugin that provides the ChatProvider
      locale - the locale to change
      player - the player that will experience the locale change
      Returns:
      whether the locale change is successful

    • notifyLocaleChangeForAllProviders

      public void notifyLocaleChangeForAllProviders(Locale locale, org.bukkit.entity.Player player)
      This method allows you to attempt to change locale for a given player from all ChatProviders(given Plugins)
      Parameters:
      locale - the locale to change
      player - the player that will experience the locale change
